title: Pencelli Walks

images.title: Jaggery / Royal Oak, Pencelli
images.caption: Royal Oak, Pencelli, Powys. Village pub viewed across the B4558. The rear of the Royal Oak faces the Monmouthshire and Brecon canal.

images.title: Kenneth Yarham / Distant Brecon Beacons from lane near Llanfrynach
images.caption: Distant Brecon Beacons from lane near Llanfrynach. North of Llanfrynach, the Brecon Beacons make a fine sight on the southern edge of the Usk Valley. The distinct shape of the highest of the Beacons, Pen y Fan, can be seen through the gap in the trees and to its left, also on the skyline, is Cribyn.

images.title: Part of the River Usk from Brynich Aqueduct by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Entrance to Captain's Field, Llanfrynach by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance to Captain's Field, Llanfrynach

description: This Powys based village sits in a lovely canalside location with walkers able to enjoy the scenery of the Usk Valley and Brecon Beacons National Park. This route uses sections of the Monmouthshire and Brecon Canal and the Taff Trail to create a circular walk from the village. There's nice easy paths along the towpath before following country lanes to the neighbouring village of Llanfrynach. On the route there are fine views of the Cefn Brynich Aqueduct, the River Usk and the Brecon Beacons in the distance. To extend the walk head north into the town of Brecon where you can visit the canal basin. Heading south will take you to the worthy village of Talybont On Usk with more details on the Brecon to Talybont Canal Walk page. The popular climb to the wonderful viewpoint at Pen Y Fan is also nearby.
display_address: Pencelli, Talybont-on-Usk, Powys, Cymru / Wales, LD3 7NU, United Kingdom
